bibl.title: Letter from Sidney Wallach to Philip Showalter Hench, September 18, 1950

div1.p: Wallach sends Hench correspondence between Wallach and Siler concerning a proposed commemorative program for Walter Reed. He asks Hench to use his influence with the Reed Memorial Association to arrange a meeting to discuss the project.

div1.head: Letter from Sidney Wallach to Philip Showalter Hench, September 18, 1950
div1.opener:
Telephone: Murray Hill 4-7770
S I D N E Y W A L L A C H A S S O C I A T E S
Three Eighty One Fourth Avenue, New York 16, N. Y.
September 18, 1950
File
Reed men
assn
PUBLIC RELATIONS · MAGAZINE MANAGEMENT · CAMPAIGN PUBLICITY
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I call to your attention the enclosed correspondence enc. 1; enc. 2 with
Colonel Siler. I believe you are a member of this Association
and perhaps your intervention may be helpful in bringing about
an earlier meeting. I still feel strongly that you are the
man to head up the enterprise which we have projected; that I
can demonstrate to you how it can be done without cost to the
Association and that if done, will bring infinite values to
the Association.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Sidney Wallach SW:ap
